column5: I’m sure you’ve all seen this. I bet there will be a lot of boats out there this weekend or applying for a harbour license.
That’s awesome. No mention of it in the article and I’ve always been poor at identification;would that be a tiger? Super cool regardless.
Saw this one on a Niagara forum, believe it was caught Saturday night in the Fort Erie/ Crystal Beach area walleye trolling
Wow. Lucky to land that beast with walleye gear.
What happened on the islands should of stayed on the islands🤫. Bummer!!
Googling the article I can’t say I’ve ever heard the term “Cabbage Dragon” before either, but I like it,
Cabbage Dragon...It's a moniker for Musky you often hear up in North Western Ontario...LOTW, Eagle, Lac Seul...
Cabbage dragon = muskie and people complain about the word pickerel = walleye
I fish all those lakes (except LOTW) and it’s the first time I’ve heard it, but love it!

Up in your neck of the woods... https://www.instagram.com/p/Bcu6YWlF8b3/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y= I heard the term for first time on LOTW many years ago...and just this September I was at Lac Seul Outposts and heard it from the owners amongst others..
Nope, just a spotted muskie.  Nice fish!!
